To note, I ran into this whilst looking to implement zoneout re: #561.

For now I've avoided current.masked_copy(noise, prev) and am instead using (1 - noise) * current + noise * prev (where noise is a binary dropout mask containing [0, 1]).

body:
To note, I ran into this whilst looking to implement zoneout re: https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/561.

For now I've avoided `current.masked_copy(noise, prev)` and am instead using `(1 - noise) * current + noise * prev` (where `noise` is a binary dropout mask containing [0, 1]).
